FeedItems.Title: Getting Started With NuGet 5.8
FeedItems.Summary:
Getting started with NuGet 5.8
NuGet 5.8 is included in Visual Studio 16.8 and .NET 5.0 out of the box. You can also download NuGet 5.8 for Windows, macOS, and Linux as a standalone executable.

Events.RelatedBody:
@MGWVc### For issues regarding the NuGet client tools (the Visual Studio extension, NuGet.exe command line tool, etc.), file a bug on [NuGet Home](https://github.com/nuget/home/issues).

### Describe the bug
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Using this git commit of NuGetGallery '...'
2. Run this code '....'
3. See error

### Expected behavior
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

### Screenshots
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

### Additional context
Add any other context about the problem here.

Twitter.com/MGWVc### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
A clear and concise description of what the problem is.
Example: I am trying to do [...] but [...]

### Describe the solution you'd like
A clear and concise description of what you want to happen. Include any alternative solutions you've considered.

### Additional context
Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Latest release version of NuGet.Packaging and NuGet.Protocol." (#8335) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Progress on https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8230

To enable Gallery to accept new OSI and FSF approved licenses need to bump NuGet.Packaging version.
NuGet.Protocol was updated just to align with NuGet.Packaging and get off preview version.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "The number of Downloads for my lib stays at zero whereas We have downloaded it tens of times" (#8334) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Bug Descrption
The number of __Downloads for my lib stays at zero__ whereas we have downloaded it tens of times at work or from home. This is not a good incentive to ¬´¬†sell¬†¬ª the lib ;-)

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Open https://www.nuget.org/packages/Diverse/ and see 0 as downloads for the component
2. Download the components (either via nuget package manager in visual studio or through the download package link on nuget.org
3. Wait a while, refresh the page https://www.nuget.org/packages/Diverse/ : the downloads count remains zero...

### Expected behavior
I‚Äôm expecting the nuget.org gallery to display the relevant number of downloads for my package. At least not zero (which is not a good selling argument ;-)

### Screenshots

![6D14A75F-E5A4-44D3-8C5D-1C1FFA25BF1C](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2824069/100060150-761d4300-2e2c-11eb-9dcc-a5b444c717a3.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NuGet restore fails to restore random packages due to empty source parameter" (#10304) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe):
Used on a Azure DevOps build agent running in Docker. 
NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): 5.4.0 x64
dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate): did not reach the build step
VS version (if appropriate): did not reach the build step
OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): windowsservercore-ltsc2016 (10.0.14393)
Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: intermittently works
## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem
1. The issue is intermittent and subsequent restores succeed 
Logs (redacted):

NuGet Config files used:
    C:\azp\agent\_work\45\s\NuGet.config

Feeds used:
    C:\Users\ContainerAdministrator\.nuget\packages\
    https://ORG.pkgs.visualstudio.com/_packaging/OUR-INTERNAL-FEED-NAME/nuget/v3/index.json
    https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json

Installed:
    134 package(s) to packages.config projects
##[error]The nuget command failed with exit code(1) and error(Errors in packages.config projects
    Unable to find version '6.1.11' of package 'OUR-PACKAGE-NAME'.
      C:\Users\ContainerAdministrator\.nuget\packages\: Package 'OUR-PACKAGE-NAME.6.1.11' is not found on source 'C:\Users\ContainerAdministrator\.nuget\packages\'.
      https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json: Package 'OUR-PACKAGE-NAME.6.1.11' is not found on **source '**
      https://ORG.pkgs.visualstudio.com/_packaging/OUR-INTERNAL-FEED-NAME/nuget/v3/index.json: Getting package 'OUR-PACKAGE-NAME.6.1.11' from **source '**

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Hard to see the dash-line box of package format when navigating by tab through the ‚ÄúChoose NuGet Package Manager Format‚Äù dialog in Dark theme" (#9729) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
NuGet version: NuGet Client Dev\5.7.0.6677
VS Version: Master\30226.129
OS: Windows-10-Enterprise-RS5
## Detailed repro steps 
1. Launch VS and make sure the theme is ‚ÄúDark‚Äù.
2. Create a C# Console Application (.NET Framework) project via VS and select ‚ÄúAll format selection on first package install‚Äù in the settings dialog.
3. Open PM UI, click a package in ‚ÄúBrowse‚Äù tab and lick ‚ÄúInstall‚Äù button and navigate by Tab key through the opened ‚ÄúChoose NuGet Package Manager Format‚Äù dialog.
4. Check if the dash-line box can be seen clearly when the focus are on package format radio boxes: ‚ÄúPackages.config‚Äù and ‚ÄúPackageReference in project file‚Äù.
## Expected
The dash-line box can be seen clearly when the focus are on package format radio boxes: ‚ÄúPackages.config‚Äù and ‚ÄúPackageReference in project file‚Äù.
## Actual
Hard to see the dash-line box when the focus are on package format radio boxes: ‚ÄúPackages.config‚Äù and ‚ÄúPackageReference in project file‚Äù as below screenshot.
![629](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632625/86011606-79fc9300-ba4f-11ea-8b4e-b7e4126b84de.png)
## Note
It is not a regression bug since it repro on 16.5 GA (D16.5 29905.175 with implicit NuGet version 5.5.0.6473).

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "5.8 + 16.8 Cannot resolve transient dependencies" (#10326) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe):

NuGet version (5.8):
VS version (if appropriate): 16.8.x

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version
Not entirely sure, but we did not experience an issue before installing 5.8 + 16.8.X
NuGet version (5.7):
VS version (if appropriate): 16.7.x

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

Given a project dependency chain::

```
TestProject (netcoreapp3.1) 
‚ïö MvcWebApplication (net461, packages.config old-style csproj) 
  ‚ïö DependencyA (netstandard2) 
    ‚ïö TransientProjectB (netstandard2)
```

The TestProject use classes from TransientProjectB directly in a test.

This fails with 
>D:\a\mixed-repro\mixed-repro\TestProject\UnitTest1.cs(3,7): error CS0246: The type or namespace name 'TransientProjectB' could not be found (are you missing a using directive or an assembly reference?) [D:\a\mixed-repro\mixed-repro\TestProject\TestProject.csproj]

The solution builds _fine_ in the IDE (Visual Studio 2019 16.8.X), but not via msbuild on the command line (and hence, not on our build servers).

It's easily enough fixed by adding a direct reference instead of keeping it transient, but was this breaking change on purpose? Why did it work in 16.7 whilst not in 16.8?

### Sample Project
Repo: https://github.com/icenorge/mixed-repro
Build script: https://github.com/icenorge/mixed-repro/blob/master/.github/workflows/MSBuild.yml
Failing build: https://github.com/icenorge/mixed-repro/runs/1453122655?check_suite_focus=true

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "LocalPackageFileCache provides no extension point for users to improve its performance " (#10325) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (any):

NuGet version (any):

dotnet.exe --version (any):

VS version (any):

OS version (any):

Worked before? never

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

We are using NuGet.Commands.RestoreCommand to restore nuget packages and store them on Azure Storage.

Unfortunately LocalPackageFileCache is very slow and in order to optimize it we need to extend it. Unfortunately the class does not implement any interface nor has virtual methods.

Set fallback folders and install path to a disk with slow access. Restoring from it will be slow even if all packages are cached because LocalPackageFileCache try to access the actual files. Still in specific user scenario checking for the actual disk files may be avoid and performance may be improved.

## Other suggested things

Making LocalPackageFileCache methods virtual would be the minimum requirement to give NuGet clients an extension point for optimizations.

### Verbose Logs

Not applicable

### Sample Project

Not applicable

```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "No error occurred when packing a .NET Core package with an invalid format icon " (#10324) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
NuGet version: NuGet Client Dev\5.9.0.6971
VS Version: Main\30724.151
OS: Windows-10-Enterprise-19h2
## Detailed repro steps 
1.In the Developer Command Prompt for VS, create a project with ‚Äòdotnet new classlib -o InvalidNetCoreIcon‚Äô 
2.Make an invalid image file (size not limited to 1 MB with txt format) and locate in the package. 
3.Open the project file and modify the file as follows: 
```
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk"> 
  <PropertyGroup> 
    ‚Ä¶ 
<PackageIcon>icon.txt</PackageIcon> 
    ‚Ä¶ 
  </PropertyGroup> 
  <ItemGroup> 
    <None Include="icon.txt" Pack="true" PackagePath="" /> 
  </ItemGroup> 
</Project> 
```
4.Pack the project with `dotnet pack` 
## Expected
There should be Error NU5045 (same with the fix for .NET Framework package) show in Developer Command Prompt for VS. 
## Actual
No error occurred as below.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632625/100210067-8248f380-2f45-11eb-9812-be3f395fdf21.png)
## Note
1.This is to say: the fix for bug 9311---`Adds icon filename extension validation NuGet/NuGet.Client#3716` should also available for .NET Core package. 
2.This is not a regression bug.

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "November dry run for custom V2 OData query deprecation" (#48) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
We announced the deprecation of custom V2 OData queries (https://github.com/NuGet/Announcements/issues/37) last year and we will begin blocking endpoints used by 3rd party clients in **February 2021**. 

We will conduct **a dry run of the OData deprecation** to ensure that there are no surprises for users, which is scheduled to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. The goal is to help you identify systems that may be affected and will give you an opportunity to take action before we permanently remove support for select v2 endpoints.
¬†
There will be two stages in the brown-out to accommodate a variety of usage scenarios. During these times, we will be heavily monitoring social media and other communication channels to address questions and concerns. 
	¬∑ **Nov. 11, 2020** ‚Äì 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each
	¬∑ **Nov. 17 & 18, 2020**¬† ‚Äì¬†48 hours

Please let us know about your questions or concerns on [this discussion post](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7423).
¬†
Refer to the table below to identify the test slot time in your time zone.
	¬∑ UTC-9 to UTC-2 ‚Äì¬†[Green test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Green+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3923&ah=4)
	¬∑ UTC-1 to UTC+6 ‚Äì¬†[Yellow test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Yellow+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3915&ah=4)
	¬∑ UTC+7 to UTC-10 ‚Äì¬†[Blue test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Blue+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3909&ah=4)
